txt.en: 'Now that our first guests have arrived, I know it was the correct course of action.'
'I would like to welcome Felági of the Temámir and Várenok of the Kámbrada to our humble feast.'
Join the feast!
'Join us my friends!'
'Thank you Felági. Thank you Várenok. You are both welcome to stay at Gundabad for as long as you wish.'
Eat some food!
'I am honoured to be here amongst many welcoming strangers, and I hope we do not remain strangers for much longer!'
'I am glad to have received the missive from the Longbeards' king. Wise King Jegín of the Temámir sends her regards to your successes in Gundabad.'
'Or Gorgar bound in chains!'
Join the feast!
'Ah I was just speaking to Ausma of the Stout-axes, a long lost cousin, if the missive I received is true!'
'It must be, for I am here now and see this gathering with my own eyes. Ha!'
'I speak for all the Kámbrada when I congratulate your well-fought win at the Gates of Gundabad.'
Eat some food ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Prince Ingór, I thought we had guests on this evening.'
Prince Ingór has declared a Zhélruka Clan feast to commemorate their new Mountain-home.
Drink some drinks!
Listen to Prince Ingór.
'Durin agreed to let us live here, and we honour him for it! Now, let us all feast together!'
'Durin agreed to let us live here, and he had better live up to his word! Now, Let us all feast together!'
Drink some drinks ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Prince Ingór has put on a lively feast!
Listen to Prince Ingór
Ate some food ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Welcome one and all, to Gundabad, the home of the Zhélruka.'
'Welcome one and all, to Gundabad, the home of the Zhélruka.'
'I thought our guest might be Durin.'
Mission: The Zhélruka Clan, Chapter 10
Drank some drinks ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Welcome all!'
'Eat, eat!'
'There is plenty to drink!'
'Ahem! Now, as your Prince, may I have your attention for a few moments?'
'Zhélruka, and friends of the Zhélruka, I have gathered you here to celebrate.'
'It has been a long road, roaming without a home. Our efforts were not in vain.'
'Gundabad will soon be ours. Our children will call this place home.'
'On this day of revelry, we know that there is still much to be done. The hardest task, however, is now behind us.'
'Enough guesses! I am getting to that!'
'Gundabad is not just a home to the Zhélruka but for all dwarves.'
'Gundabad is a sacred place, and all dwarves should be allowed passage through these halls.'
'When King Thorin sent missives to dwarves afar, I admit I was hesitant.'
